Welcome to Graph animation’s documentation!¶

src.render_graph.build_colors_list(graph: networkx.classes.graph.Graph, nodes_colors_dict: Dict[Any, src.constants.Color], edges_colors_dict: Dict[Tuple, src.constants.Color]) → Tuple[List[str], List[str]][source]¶

Utility function used to determine colors of nodes and edges

Parameters

  • graph (networkx.Graph) – Graph

  • nodes_attr_dict (Dict[Any, Color]) – Dictionary that contains colors of all(!) nodes

  • edges_attr_dict (Dict[Tuple, Color]) – Dictionary that contains colors of all(!) edges

Returns

A tuple that contains two arrays of colors. One for nodes and the other for edges.

Return type

Tuple[List[str], List[str]]

src.render_graph.make_traversal_frames(graph: networkx.classes.graph.Graph, trav: Iterator[Tuple[src.constants.GraphElementType, Any]]) → List[PIL.Image.Image][source]¶

Creates a list of frames that constitute an animation of the given traversal in a graph.

Parameters

  • graph (networkx.Graph) – Graph

  • trav (Generator[Tuple[GraphElementType, Any]]) – Traversal generator that yields a tuple of (yielded graph element type, element itself)

Returns

List of frames

Return type

List[PIL.Image.Image]

src.render_graph.render_graph(graph: networkx.classes.digraph.DiGraph, nodes_colors_dict: Dict[Any, src.constants.Color], edges_colors_dict: Dict[Tuple, src.constants.Color], pos: dict) → PIL.Image.Image[source]¶

Creates image of a graph as an array of pixels

Parameters

  • graph (networkx.DiGraph) – Graph

  • nodes_attr_dict (Dict[Any, Color]) – Dictionary that contains colors of all(!) nodes

  • edges_attr_dict (Dict[Tuple, Color]) – Dictionary that contains colors of all(!) edges

  • pos (dict) – networkx graph layout

Returns

Array of pixels

Return type

PIL.Image.Image
